titles.title: A bill to reauthorize the Fishermen's Protective Act.

action.text: Referred to House Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries.
Executive Comment Requested from State, Commerce.
Referred to Subcommittee on Fisheries and Wildlife Conservation and the Environment.
Subcommittee on Fisheries and Wildlife Conservation and the Environment Discharged.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Reported to House (Amended) by House Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries. Report No: 100-299.
Called up by House Under Suspension of Rules.

vote.text: Passed House (Amended) by Yea-Nay Vote: 404 - 0 (Record Vote No: 335).

calendar.text: Received in the Senate. Read twice. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 356. Pursuant to the order of August 3, 1987.

action.text: Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.

vote.text: Passed Senate with amendments by Voice Vote.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
House Agreed to Senate Amendments by Unanimous Consent.

committee.subcommittee: Fisheries and Wildlife Conservation and the Environment
committee.name: House Merchant Marine and Fisheries

bill.summary: 10/14/1987--Passed Senate amended. (Measure passed Senate, amended) Amends the Fishermen's Protective Act to extend, from October 1, 1987, to October 1, 1988, the termination date of provisions authorizing the Secretary of State to make reimbursements for certain losses upon the seizure of a U.S. documented commercial fishing vessel by a foreign country. Removes the restriction of current law which limits to developing countries the provision of setting aside surplus Government vessels for use in humanitarian services. Extends to October 22, 1989, the termination date relating to setting aside such surplus Government vessels. Extends to November 15, 1987 (currently, October 15, 1987), the moratorium period on the documentation of foreign-built fish processing vessels.
